alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 12:01AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Davidson and Forsyth. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1200 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Additional rainfall is continuing to move into the region from the southwest. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winston-Salem, Clemmons, Lewisville, Walkertown, Pfafftown, Stanleyville and Sedge Garden. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Bethania Station Rd at Bethabara Park Blvd, Reynolda Rd at Bethabara Park Blvd, S Main St at E Salem Ave, Hawthorne Rd at W 1st St, Northwest Blvd at Thurmond St, Phillips Bridge Rd at Muddy Creek, Indiana Ave at E 28th St, Waterworks Rd at Frazier Creek, University Pkwy at Coliseum Dr and Old Town Dr near Bethania Station Rd. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
